The Queen Anneâ€™s Bounty Act 1714 (1 Geo. 1. St. 2. c. 10) was an act of the Parliament of Great Britain. It was one of the Queen Anne's Bounty Acts 1706 to 1870.
The long title of the act was:
Subsequent developments
The act gave augmented churches legal personality as corporations. The remaining sections of the act still in force were repealed by section 1 of, and part I of the schedule to, the Statute Law (Repeals) Measure 2018.
